title: conman uk luxury home for rent on run cops
story: Zahid Khan, , is living in a penthouse in the Middle East while on the run for his part in a £, car number plate scam.The fugitive playboy has been taunting cops by flaunting his lavish lestyle as he lives it up in Dubai with Floyd Mayweather and Busta Rhymes.And brazen Khan has now revealed on Facebook he is looking to rent out his luxury detached home in Birmingham complete with swimming pool and cinema.The six-bedroom mansion also boasts three bathrooms, a jacuzzi and steam room, is fully furnished and has full CCTV and gated premises, Birmingham Live reports.Khan hasnt said how much he wants for the property but confirmed he would be willing to let out inidual rooms.The conman skipped bail and fled the UK just days before being caged for ten years over the fraud, which involved stealing the rights to car number plates and selling them on illegally.Among his victims were EuroMillions winner Gillian Bayford, who scooped a £million jackpot in August .Birmingham Crown Court heard how Khan was living in a playboy lestyle at the time and may have married three dferent women in Muslim ceremonies.Now hes living it up while his brothers Aamir and Ayan and cousin Zubair Ahmad, who were also convicted over the scam, languish in jail.Khan said he would only the Prime Minister could assure him of his safety, claiming his le is under threat from members of the EDL.And he claimed he escaped to Dubai because he was the victim of corrupt police who are waging a personal vendetta against him, which led to him not getting a fair trial.But videos show he was free to hang out at a celebrity belly-dancing party two months ago with boxing legend Mayweather.He told said: It was a great night and Floyd was brilliant, shadow boxing while the dancers were performing, he was loving it.Hes a lovely guy and an inspiration. A lot of people say hes arrogant butyou get to know the guy, hes very down to earth and humble.I know a lot of celebrities but you know what  Money does not buy you respect, you have to earn it.The fraudster also filmed himself with US star Busta Rhymes at a Christmas party in Dubai - and hes also met YouTube singing sensation Lana Rose.Back in Birmingham the millionaire used to drive a £, Ferrari  Spider until it was seized and crushed by police.Now he reportedly claims: I get chauffeured everywhere.Khan, whose we and kids still live in Birmingham, fled before the end of his fraud trial.Among his victims were EuroMillions winner Gillian Bayford, who scooped a £million jackpot in August .He was convicted in his absence of conspiracy to commit fraud, perverting the course of justice, plus concealing and converting criminal property.Khan also admitted three counts of fraudulently obtaining car insurance and was convicted on a fourth count he’d denied.

title: d day landings normandy ww2 rare photos
story: Terrying pictures of the Normandy landings include a haunting image of a corpse washed up against sea defences and a photo capturing the fear and trepidation in the eyes of a wounded soldier under fire.Other incredible images include a rare soldier’s perspective of the battle through a port hole, soldiers wading towards the shore under a hail of gunfire, and a soon-to-be German prisoner buried up to his chest in a collapsed trench.Historian Brooke S. Blades’ new book The Americans On D-Day And In Normandy: Rare Photographs From Wartime Archives offers an enthralling and gruesome insight into what the American soldiers faced on the D-day landings of  June .D-Day saw tens of thousands of courageous allied soldiers face up to the terrying prospect of landing on France’s northern shoreline to liberate Europe.Blades wrote: “Omaha Beach and other Normandy locations are sacred places to many today.“The D-Day beaches were in large measure the primary gateways, the low doors in the Atlantic Wall that led, through heroism, suffering and sacrice, to the liberation of Western Europe.“This volume proposes to revitalise both landscape and person, at least for the Americans who were there and the civilians they encountered.On D-Day, more than , ground troops and , paratroopers flooded to Normandy to take back North West Europe from the Nazi forces.Given the incredible scale of the invasion and the dangers, the allied forces suffered more than , casualties.The number of German dead ranges anywhere between , and ,.Blades was determined to use his collection of photographs to remind the free world of the sacrices made by the allied troops during one of the bloodiest periods of the Second World War.In the weeks after the landings, including D-Day itself, the Battle of Normandy saw over , Allied and German troops killed, wounded or missing.

title: emiliano sala ex girlfriend urges fans keep praying
story: Devastated Bernice Schkair shared a picture of the £m striker with the caption #prayforsala as investigators prepared to recover the debris.It comes just weeks after she pleaded for the “football mafia” to be investigated over Sala’s disappearance.She wrote in a now-deleted tweet: Investigate the football mafia because I do not believe it was an accident.”The -year-old previously told of her heartbreak in an emotional Instagram post, writing: “I want to wake up and all of this to be a lie.I feel impotent, I’m in a nightmare. I cannot stop thinking about you, Emi.Investigators have not yet confirmedthe body belongs to -year-old Sala or his Brit pilot, Dave Ibbotson, .The downed Piper Malibu was located near Alderney after state-of-the-art side-sonar kit scoured the seabed.Leading the search was shipwreck hunter David Mearns with his Morven vessel and the AAIBs own ship.A ROV robot was then sent down to the seabed to identy the remains, on Sunday morning.The AAIB said: Based on analysis of ROV video footage, the AAIB investigators on board the vessel concluded that the object is wreckage from the missing Piper Malibu aircraft, registration NDB.The ROV carried out a further search of the area overnight but did not identy any additional pieces of wreckage.Tragically, in video footage from the ROV, one occupant is visible amidst the wreckage. The AAIB is now considering the next steps, in consultation with the families of the pilot, passenger and police.The image shows the rear left side of the fuselage including part of the aircraft registration.We intend to publish an interim report within one month of the accident occurring.Salas loved ones were rocked by the news with his ex-girlfriend posting tributes on social media to the Argentine ace.Meanwhile the strikers dad broke down yesterday as he spoke to reporters near his home in Santa Fe, Argentina.He told Cronica TV: They told me that the days passed and there was no news of Emiliano or the plane.A second hunt for Salas missing plane was launched after his family and footie stars, including Lionel Messi, raised £K to launch a private search.Mr Mearns said last night: “A plane carrying Emiliano Sala and piloted by Dave Ibbotson, , has been located by my crew.The families have been informed.“This is about the best result we could expect for the families, but is devastating news.”The plane was carrying Cardf City’s £million record signing Sala, , to the Welsh capital from former club Nantes, in Western France, when it vanished on January .Within a few hours search vessel FBV Morven picked up a signal and a remote-controlled submarine fitted with a camera was sent down to formally identy the wreckage.On Wednesday, the AAIB said two seat cushions believed to be from the plane were found off Normandy.

title: how 21 savage grew up london
story: The hip hop star, who has forged a hugely successful career claiming he was born in Atlanta, Georgia, is actually from Newham - and moved to the US when his parents split, Sun Online can reveal.Savage, whose real name is Sheyaa Bin Abraham, came to the US from the UK on a visa when he was  in  and never left, officials say.It is believed he travelled to America with his mum, Heather Joseph, after she and his dad Kevin Emmons split up around that time.Sources today told The Sun Online his father Kevin remains living in London, working for Westminster Council, while his grandma lives in Brixton.They added that his gran even flew out to the US to help bail him out of jail when he was facing drug charges in .The source said: Part of me it was pretty shocked but I can understand why hes done it. To have the gangster rapper image you have to portray that image. But really hes a softie from London.Theres a story on Wikipedia stating he saw a gun when he was eight.I can tell you that is not true at all. If you know his dad, you would know his dad is nothing like that at all.Hes done stuff about his dad being a drug dealer and that sort of thing.His dad is a hard-working man. That is so not his dad. His dad gets up to go to work six days a week.Abraham-Joseph has previously spoken about growing up in beat-up a** apartments in Atlanta with Heather and four brothers and six sisters.In a  interview, he claimed he was banned from all schools in his area after bringing a gun to class when he was  or , and said he remembered seeing his first gun when he was eight.In  he was also convicted of drug charges in Fulton County, Georgia.The source added: When he first got arrested in America, his grandmother from Brixton was the one to fly out and bail him out.The grandmother, shes one of the most hardworking people youll meet and never took a day off work.A spokesman for US Immigration and Customs Enforcementyesterday told CNN: His whole public persona is . He actually came to the US from the UK as a teen and overstayed his visa.

title: venezuela juan guaido real president maduro crackdown uk
story: The move piles fresh pressure on the embattled socialist despot Nicolas Maduro and comes after he missed Sundays deadline to call fresh presidential elections.Mr Guaido proclaimed himself as temporary president on January  but Mr Maduro has showed no signs of ending his six-year presidency voluntarily. Mr Maduro has launched a brutal crackdown on his own people as he refuses to relinquish his grip on power.The UK joins a host of other European countries including France, Spain, Germany, Sweden, Lithuania, Austria and Denmark in backing Mr Guaido in recognising the opposition leader.The US and a string of South American countries had already recognised him as interim president until new elections can be held.Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt announced today: The United Kingdom now recognises Juan Guaido as the constitutional interim president of Venezuela, until credible presidential elections can be held.The people of Venezuela have suffered enough. It is time for a new start, with free and fair elections in accordance with international democratic standards.The oppression of the illegitimate, kleptocratic Maduro regime must end. Those who continue to violate the human rights of ordinary Venezuelans under an illegitimate regime will be called to account.The Venezuelan people deserve a better future.The crisis in Venezuela has sparked a bitter row in Jeremy Corbyns Labour party, whose frontbench has repeatedly failed to condemn Mr Maduros tyrannic leadership of the country.Last week he sparked after he slammed the UK Government’s call for sanctions on Mr Maduro. The Labour leader condemned “outside interference” against the despot.He has called for “dialogue” with Maduro - even though he stubbornly refused to sit down for Brexit talks with Theresa May for days.Mr Corbyn has been a long-standing ally of the socialist Venezualan regime and has tweeted his backing for Mr Maduro despite the economic ruin he has presided over.Mr Guaido has argued Mr Maduros re-election in May was fraudulent and that, as head of the Venezuelan congress, the countrys constitution gave him power to declare himself interim president.

title: sue parents giving birth without consent kidnap slavery
story: Raphael Samuel said he had a “great relationship” with his parents but that just didn’t make up for the injustice of the birth to begin with.The Mumbai resident is an anti-natalist – meaning he believes it is wrong to put an unwilling child through the trials and tribulations of le for the pleasure of its parents.The anti-natalist movement is gaining traction in India as younger people resist social pressure to have children.Speaking to The Print Samuel said he loved his parents but “they had me for their joy and their pleasure.“My le has been amazing, but I dont see why I should put another le through the rigamarole of school and finding a career, especially when they didnt ask to exist.”Samuel’s not alone in his beliefs.His preposterous Facebook page, Nihilanand, has hundreds of followers.One image posted to the group is captioned “parents are hypocrite”.“A good parent puts the child above is wants and needs... but the child itself is a want of the parent.”A similar meme proclaims: If parents truly know what is good for their children... why did they have them In yet another shows of magnicent deductive reasoning one meme reads: “The only reason your children are facing problems is because you had them”.Some anti-natalist activists in India also argue that having children is a strain on Earths resources and environment.Fellow activist Pratima Naik, said: “We dont want to impose our beliefs on anyone, but more people need to consider why having a child in the world right now isnt right.”His page, Childfree India, posted last month to say: “Should we continue to bring more children in this world and accelerate the process of environmental and social degradation ”

title: hatton garden suspect basil denies ignore films
story: Michael Seed, , is accused of being part of the robbery, which saw jewels, gold ingots and cash looted from safety deposit boxes.He was also allegedly had a role in a £million raid on Chatila jewellers in Mayfair during the August Bank Holiday weekend of .Jurors being selected to try Seed at Woolwich Crown Court were today told to ignore any dramatisations of the famous Hatton Garden raid.Judge Christopher Kinch, QC, said: The point is to flush out someone who may have a particular obsession with the reports or indeed someone who has perhaps worked on one of the books or films.The burglary, which took place over the  Easter Bank Holiday Weekend, was turned into a blockbuster film starring Michael Caine and Ray Winstone.King of Thieves premiered on September  and was widely advertised on London Underground before its release.A list of questions given to potential jurors asked whether they recognised a list of names - John Kenneth Collins, Daniel Jones, Terence George Perkins, Brian Reader, Carl Wood, William Lincoln, Hugh Doyle, and Charles Matthews.They were also asked whether they have any connection to London City Metal or Chatila Jewellers.The list said: The Hatton Garden burglary and the trial that followed were widely publicised in the press, on TV, on the internet and in the cinema.Did you or anyone you know lose property during the burglary of the Hatton Garden Safety Deposit at - Hatton Garden. I am sure everyone will be aware of that incident Are you or have you in the past worked for the flying squad, that is the team of police officers who investigated this, and the related cases and we would need to knowanyone had that sort of connection Seed, of Islington, North London, denies two counts of conspiracy to burgle and one count of conspiracy to conceal or disguise criminal property.A trial, expected to last six weeks, will begin today.

title: ebay auction wish selling machete knives
story: Sellers on Wish offer a range of the razor-sharp blades - some of which come splashed with imitation BLOOD.One .-inch machete - labelled the Zombie killer - comes in acid green with a skull-embossed black sheath.A reviewer wrote that it was comfortable to use, perfectly sized and a strong razor sharp blade.The US-based apps British marketplace also displays the -inch Bolo-Machete Messer - which comes with painted-on bloodstains.The site also offers samurai swords, knuckle-dusters, daggers, tasers, and imitation pistols.It allows parents to sign their terms and conditions for kids older than  - and does appear to prevent users listing blades.Patrick Green, CEO of anti-kne charity The Ben Kinsella Trust said: These deadly weapons are clearly marketed to look like toys or fashions accessories.They are neither, these knives are responsible for bringing misery to more and more families every year.What is worse is that the branding on the knives are clearly designed to appeal to young people, many of whom will not understand the dangers that these knives pose to themselves and others.Wishs actions in allowing these knives to be advertised and purchased from their website is reprehensible and they should be removed immediately.

title: brexit latest theresa may deal backstop
story: Andrea Jenkyns  asked the secretary general of the EU commission todaythe PM had ever demanded the most controversial aspect of the Brexit deal be scrapped.She tweeted: I asked Martin Selmayr whether the PM had ever asked for the backstop to be removed. He stated that he wasnt aware of her asking for this and had certainly not asked him.He also stated that there has been no request to reopen negations by the British Gov.The news will spark disbelief among Brexiteers who already think the PM hasnt been tough enough with the EU so far.Today Leave-backing MPs have told Mrs May that the only way to save her deal is to ditch the hated Northern Irish backstop as they team up with Remainers MPs to find a solution.The PM has summoned a group of top Tories to knuckle down this week and figure out how to persuade the EU to give us a dferent system for the Irish border.They will discuss a compromise proposal created by a cross-Brexit group last week which would involve extending our transition period for a year to get a trade deal, and would rip up the current backstop arrangement.MPs include Brexiteers Marcus Fysh and Owen Paterson, with Remainers Damian Green and Nicky Morgan. They will meet with Brexit Secretary Steve Baker later today.Mr Fysh told the BBC this morning that the ideas were brand new, saying: These are proposals that have not been discussed in the negotiations yet.Talks will go on into Tuesday and Wednesday too in a hope they will figure out a detailed solution to break the deadlock as soon as possible.Time is running out as the clock runs down to March .Today No announced that Mrs May will make a surprise trip to Northern Ireland tomorrow - where she will make a speech and meet with local businesses.And this morning leading Brexiteer Jacob Rees-Mogg hinted thatthey came to an agreement based on the so-called Malthouse Compromise then yes, I could swallow the rest of the withdrawal agreement.However, he also insisted thatwe leave without a deal, so be it.Yesterday Home Secretary Sajid Javid gave the talks a boost as he said that existing technology could be used to solve the problem.If the EU could show a little bit of good will then a deal could be arranged.But just hours later the Irish Prime Minister insisted that all the options had already been rejected by the EU.He told RTE radio: If [Sajid Javid] has been shown this, I think wed all love to see it.And last night EU negotiator Sabine Weyand tweeted: Can technology solve the Irish border problem  Short answer: not in the next few years.Yesterday some Brexiteers hinted that a fragile Tory truce was on the verge of breaking as they believed the PM to be reneging on her promises already.Steve Baker and Andrea Leadsom came out all guns blazing to insist that a legally binding letter wouldnt be enough to get them to back the deal.Mr Baker warned there could be trouble ahead and the PMs deal could get knocked down againshe doesnt deliver on her vow to rip up the hated backstop.But Remainer MPs said the so-called compromise was a pig in lipstick and just wouldnt work.Pro-Peoples Vote campaigner Guto Bebb said: The Malthouse Compromise is a choice between a backstop-free unicorn Brexit and a pig-in-lipstick version of a No Deal Brexit. Neither beast is going to fly.Rather than have another round of game playing and fantasy Brexit, my appeal to all Conservatives is to put country ahead of party and recognise with Parliament so deeply ided we have to agree on a deliverable rather than a fantasy Brexit and then allow the public a final say through a Peoples Vote.The Prime Minister is set to discuss the plans with EU bosses - although theres no time frame yet of when that might happen.Some Tories think shes deliberately running down the clock to try and force MPs into backing her deal at the last moment.She will then have to bring her proposals of a compromise back to the house of Commons for another vote so they can sign it off.

title: brexit jacob rees mogg support pm deal second referendum
story: The leading Eurosceptic admitted that supporting the PM could be the only way to ensure Brexit actually happens.And in another boost to Mrs May, top Labour figures called on all parties to work together for a deal.Mr Rees-Mogg, chair of the hardline European Research Group, voted against the PMs deal last month and led efforts to try to kick her out of office.He is adamant that ministers should consider going for No Deal - but today warned that Remainer MPs will do their utmost to block it.The Brexiteer told LBC: The arithmetic in the House of Commons is that such a proposal is very unlikely to get through.There is a group of MPs who are trying very very hard to stop Brexit, never wanted it in the first place.If its possible to get a compromise through Parliament that leaves us in a favourable situation, then I think it is worth compromising to ensure that we leave.Hinting that he could perform a U-turn and back Mrs Mays deal, he added: The ERG wants us to leave the European Union, thats our biggest aim.If we can unite the party, have a strong Government and leave the European Union, that would be a satisfactory outcome.Butby accident we leave without a deal because the Prime Minister doesn’t run with this or the EU refuses it then so be it.Mr Rees-Mogg admitted that forking over £billion to the EU as part of the withdrawal agreement was a ransom that we are paying our freedom, but insisted it would be money well spent.Brexiteers have demanded the PM remove the Irish backstop, which is designed to avoid a hard border, before they can support her deal.But Mr Rees-Moggs comments will raise Nos hopes that the ERG will come around in any case out of fear of a second referendum.Top Labour MPs today hinted they too could end up backing Mrs Mays deal because they dont want to crash out of the EU on March .She will hold more talks with her backbenchers this week and head to Northern Ireland for fresh discussions about the thorny issue of the Irish border.Once she’s got a plan she thinks MPs can back, she is set to go back to Brussels to persuade them to endorse it.MPs’ half-term recess has been cancelled to deal with Brexit and get us ready to leave on March .The next crunch votes are now set to take place on Valentines Day -  February.The Commons will get a new opportunity to have its say on what happens next. There could be bids to try and delay Brexit again like Yvette Cooper’s amendment, or even a second referendum.Meanwhile, some MPs are considering whether to resign their party whips in order to defy their leader.One Labour MP was reported to be mulling resigning unless Jeremy Corbyn backed a so-called People’s Vote.And Tories like Sarah Wollaston have said they would quit the partyMrs May targets a No Deal outcome.Lisa Nandy, who represents the pro-Brexit seat of Wigan, said: I, and many others, have concluded that passing the Prime Minister’s withdrawal agreement is the only way through this mess.Shadow Business Minister Bill Esterson added: We must overcome our dferences. We must recognise our shared goals of avoiding No Deal or other hard Brexit options.Justice Secretary David Gauke called on MPs to rally around the Prime Minister in short order - saying that otherwise Brexit will have to be delayed past March .

title: eu goods waved through british ports in case of no deal brexit to avoid massive jams
story: In official advice released today, HM Revenue  Customs said that “for a temporary period” it would allow “most” shipments into the country before companies have even informed them they’ve arrived.Exporters would have just over  hours to then fill in an electronic declaration.The revelation comes just months after HMRC bosses warned the UK’s post-Brexit customs system would not work properly for two years in a No Deal.HMRC chief John Thompson told MPs last year that the Government would have a choice to make – whether to keep trade moving, ensure security at the border, or collect revenues.Insiders said it appeared that HMRC had decided it was essential to keep trade moving rather than risk huge queues on the way to ports such as Dover or at Eurotunnel terminals.Hauliers have been furious at the lack of guidance from HMRC and the Government over how the customs system would work in the event of a No Deal. Today’s “updated guidance” warns that anyone importing into Brexit Britain will have to fill out a customs form before checking goods onto a ferry or train on the EU side.But it adds: “For a temporary period, HMRC will allow most goods moving from the listed roll on roll off locations to leave the UK port or train station before you’ve told us that the goods have arrived.”Ferry operators and Eurotunnel have been ordered to have “reasonable belief” customers have made the appropriate customs declarations.HMRC adds: “You can do this through your terms and conditions that your customers use when booking their transport.”The list of official roll-on, roll-off locations includes Dover and Folkestone but also smaller ports such as Heysham in Lancashire, Pembroke and Sheerness.But MPs warned that waving goods through without checks could risk safety.Best for Britain supporter Geraint Davies MP said: “They said we would take back control of our borders but now the plan is to wave things through irrespective of our safety. We’ll have no idea what is coming into our ports.”

title: brexit eu angela merkel theresa may pm
story: The German leader defied sneering Brussels Eurocrats as she called on the EU to take Mrs Mays demands seriously.Mrs Merkels vow to work closely with the UK comes as a lt to the PMs chance of rewriting her deal so MPs can finally sign it off.Mrs May has called on Brussels to fix the backstop so Britain doesnt risk getting trapped in the European customs union.Speaking in Tokyo, the German Chancellor said she was confident there is no need for a hard border in Ireland eventhe UK quits the EUs economic structures.She added that negotiators should be creative and avoid risking a No Deal outcome which would damage Europes economy.Mrs Merkel said: There are definitely options for preserving the integrity of the single market even when Northern Ireland isnt part of it because it is part of Britain while at the same time meeting the desire to have,possible, no border controls.To solve this point you have to be creative and listen to each other, and such discussions can and must be conducted.We can still use the time to perhaps reach an agreementeveryone shows good will.The German leaders stance is much more flexible than Brussels-based bureaucrats who have insisted the current withdrawal agreement cant be changed.Today Martin Selmayr, who as secretary-general of the European Commission is one of the EUs most powerful figures, suggested a No Deal was getting more likely.After meeting MPs from the Commons Brexit committee, Mr Selmayr rubbished the idea of rewriting the backstop.He blasted: On the EU side, nobody is considering this.Asked whether any assurance would help to get the Withdrawal Agreement through the Commons, the answers of MPs were inconclusive.The meeting confirmed that the EU did well to start its No Deal preparations in December .She will hold more talks with her backbenchers this week and head to Northern Ireland for fresh discussions about the thorny issue of the Irish border.Once she’s got a plan she thinks MPs can back, she is set to go back to Brussels to persuade them to endorse it.MPs’ half-term recess has been cancelled to deal with Brexit and get us ready to leave on March .The next crunch votes are now set to take place on Valentines Day -  February.The Commons will get a new opportunity to have its say on what happens next. There could be bids to try and delay Brexit again like Yvette Cooper’s amendment, or even a second referendum.Meanwhile, some MPs are considering whether to resign their party whips in order to defy their leader.One Labour MP was reported to be mulling resigning unless Jeremy Corbyn backed a so-called People’s Vote.And Tories like Sarah Wollaston have said they would quit the partyMrs May targets a No Deal outcome.Irish deputy PM Simon Coveney also insisted that alternative arrangements cant replace the backstop.He said: None of those ideas around alternative arrangements have actually stood up to scrutiny.The backstop, which is only intended to take effectthere is no other way to keep the border open, would see the UK stay in Europes customs union indefinitely - stopping us making our own trade deals.

title: hard brexiteer tweet nissan x
story: NewsThis hard Brexiteer tweet about the Nissan X-Trail has not aged wellLeave.EU were delighted about the carmaker pledging to make the X-Trail x in SunderlandShareCommentsByMikey SmithPolitical reporter:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB News "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailNissans decision to scrap plans to manufacture their X-trail x in the UK - partially blaming Brexit - was a blow to Theresa May.But it was doubly awkward for hard Brexit campaign group Leave.EU.Back in October , fresh from the success of the referendum campaign, the right wing group gleefully welcomed the Japanese carmaker announcing the diesel vehicle in the UK. In fact, they were so delighted that they made a little picture to celebrate. And it has not aged well.The image features the then-newly minted Prime Minister Theresa May , at the wheel of an X-Trail.And because Leave.EU are not known for their subtlety, they added a Union Flag livery to the SUV. Nissan blasted Brexit uncertainty last night, as a senior exec confirmed plans to build the X-Trail x in Sunderland had been scrapped. Gianluca de Ficchy, the Japanese firms Europe chairman, said that the decision had been taken for business reasons affected by rules on diesel engines and reduced sales.The announcement that the X-Trail would be built in Japan was made in a letter to staff that followed a day of political rows between Brexit supporters and opponents over the reason for one of Wearsides largest employers reneging on a  decision to build the car there.  In the letter Mr de Ficchy said: Todays announcement will be interpreted by a lot of people as a decision related to Brexit. We have taken this decision for the business reasons Ive explained, but clearly the uncertainty around the UKs future relationship with the EU is not helping companies like ours to plan for the future.

title: jeremy corbyn phoned alexandria ocasio
story: NewsJeremy Corbyn phoned Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and its caused quite a stirThe conversation has inadvertently reignited the row over anti-Semitism in the Labour PartyShareCommentsByMikey SmithPolitical reporter:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB News "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailJeremy Corbyn has spoken to Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez on the phone, to congratulate her on her election to congress. The pair held wide-reaching talks in a telephone call on Sunday evening.But the conversation has caused a stir online, after the row over anti-Semitism in the Labour party was reignited.The Labour leader said it was great to hear how the -year-old former Bernie Sanders organiser was challenging the status quo. It is understood the pair spoke for  minutes and discussed the US government shutdown and their joint condemnation of Donald Trumps plans to build a wall at the Mexican border. They also spoke about public services, climate change, tax and migration.  Ms Ocasio-Cortez, who became the youngest woman ever elected to Congress in the midterms last year, shocked many in New Yorkpoliticswhen she came out of nowhere to defeat -term representative Joe Crowley in New Yorks Democratic congressional primary. Following the telephone call on Sunday, Mr Corbyn tweeted: Great to speak to AOC on the phone this evening and hear first-hand how shes challenging the status quo. Lets build a movement across borders to take on the billionaires, polluters and migrant baiters, and support a happier, freer and cleaner planet. Ms Ocasio-Cortez replied: It was an honor to share such a lovely and wide-reaching conversation with you, @JeremyCorbyn!   Also honored to share a great hope in the peace, prosperity, + justice that everyday people can create when we uplt one another across class, race, + identity both at home  abroad. Later, writer and Elad Nehorai replied to Ms Ocasio-Cortez, asking for her to take a look at what he described as Mr Corbyns long, documented history of anti-Semitism. He added: The left’s blind spot in this regard can still be fixed. But we need leaders like yourself to listen. Ms Ocasio-Cortez replied: Thank you for bringing this to me. We cannot + will not move forward without deep fellowship and leadership with the Jewish community. I’ll have my team reach out. She added: Looking forward to the discourse and community-building ahead!But many other Twitter users replied to the pair, accusing Mr Nehorai of smearing Mr Corbyn.Mr Corbyn has repeatedly said he opposes all forms of racism, including anti-Semitism.

title: tory brandon lewis slammed shaming
story: NewsTory Brandon Lewis shames female Labour candidate for liking tweet of mans penisBrandon Lewis, named the voice of Women in Politics by his party, called for Sally Keebles resignationShareCommentsByMikey SmithPolitical reporter:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsWhat  "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailTory chairman Brandon Lewis has been slammed for attacking a female Labour candidate, demanding she be sacked for apparently liking a picture of a mans penis on Twitter . Brandon Lewis, who was last year named the voice of Women in Politics by his party, called for Labours Northampton North candidate Sally Keeble to be fired over the liked picture, which Ms Keeble says was due to her account being hacked. A similar tweet was retweeted by the account last night, but was later deleted. Update: Ms Keeble has since said Twitter have told her that her account has been accessed from three dferent locations, apparently confirming she had been hacked. She has called on Mr Lewis to apologise: Ive now referred this matter to the police. I trust Tory Chair @BrandonLewis will now apologise and delete his tweets. --- Mr Lewis most recently hit headlines when he was accused of cheating in a parliamentary vote, after failing to honour a pairing arrangement with Lib Dem deputy leader Jo Swinson, who had recently given birth.   And he was responsible for the creation of the Conservative Party Conference app. A security breach in the app resulted in the Defence Secretarys mobile phone number being posted on the internet, and Boris Johnsons profile picture being replaced with hardcore pornography.   And yet, Mr Lewis has twice called on Jeremy Corbyn to take action over the racy image. He tweeted last night: “Wonder@JeremyCorbyn or @UKLabour will be commenting on her Twitter tastes ” And this morning, he posted: “And still waiting for @JeremyCorbyn or @UKLabour to comment on why they still have her as a PPC !!” Last February Gavin Barwell, Theresa Mays chief of staff, expressed regret after apparently responding to a tweet which contained hardcore pornography involving two schoolgirls and their mum. And Andrew Grfiths was reinstated as a Tory MP, despite having sent hundreds of sexually explicit messages to two women in his constituency.   Mr Grfiths was suspended, but was given back the Tory whip in time to take part in the vote of confidence in Theresa Mays leadership. Twitter users did not react positively to Mr Lewis attack, accusing him of shaming a female politician. But due to the nature of the image, it is dficult to quote much of the reaction in a family publication. BuzzFeed reporter Alex Wickham tweeted : It’s  mate, not sure that is the best look... Columnist Owen Jones said : A senior Tory man trying to sexually shame a woman is a very very bad look. He added: Evenit wasnt accidental, who cares  Mr Lewis, challenged to resolve the furore by posting a picture of his own penis on Twitter, declined to do so, saying it was: More than unlikely!

title: beautiful woman 24 who struggled
story: News"Beautul" woman, , who struggled to cope with parents deaths is killed by trainFlur McDonald, , tragically took her own le in Southport, Merseyside, after battling mental health issues, her family sayShareCommentsByLorna HughesYolanthe Fawehinmi:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsFlur McDonald, , died after being hit by a train in Birkdale, Merseyside, last week "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA brave young woman who lost both of her parents within a few years of each other has been hit and killed by a train. Flur McDonald, , was struck by a Merseyrail train at a level barrier crossing in Southport, Merseyside, last Tuesday. It is believed she had battled mental health issues for a long time, and had struggled with the deaths of her mum and dad. Her grieving brother said his sister had never ever really got over the double tragedy, and had battled her illness every day.Police are treating Flurs death as “non suspicious”, the Liverpool Echo reports. Tributes have been pouring in for the promising pharmacology student, with one local describing her as a “beautul angel”. Another said they hoped that courageous Flur was now “at peace with her mum and dad”. Others urged those who need help to seek counselling. Diane Tomlin said on facebook: R I P Beautul Flur, such a tragic loss for her family. It can be a lonely time even when you are surrounded by family and friends, anyone out there who is struggling to stay afloat, please talk to your GP to get counselling, or phone the samaritans, and keep talking untill the dark clouds  sinking feeling goes away, there is light to be seen. Flur, from Southport, was a bright young woman who became the first member of her family to go to university.  She studied at Newcastle after leaving college. Friends from her pharmacology classes have now set up a fundraising page to raise money for the mental health charity Mind in her memory. In a poignant message shared on social media, her brother Ryan Mcdonald said: As most people are now aware my beautul baby sister flurry tragically cut her own le short the other day. I dont know that much about mental illness or mental health but I know it has claimed the most delicate, beautul, amazingly clever young women I have known, who Im absolutely proud and fortunate to have had in my le for  short but amazing years.  Flur was hit by the train at the scene on Crescent Road, between Hillside and Birkdale, just after pm on January . A British Transport Police spokeswoman that “sadly a woman in her twenties was pronounced dead at the scene where paramedics also attended. “Officers were called to the lines in Birkdale at .pm yesterday following reports a person had been struck by a train.” The spokeswoman added that “the incident is not being treated as suspicious and a file will be prepared for the coroner.”The incident caused some delays to services, the Echo reported. Good luck, time off work and respect are also among the things Brits don’t feel like they are getting enough of. The study was carried out by Virgin Active, whose aim is to inspire Brits to find a balance in all aspects of their le. It also found a lack of money is the biggest barrier to getting to ‘getting enough’ in le followed by a lack of time and lack of willpower. Israel Rivera, head of group exercise at Virgin Active said: “Our research shows there are a host of things we’re not getting enough of, including exercise. Rivera added: At Virgin Active we believe it’s important to take an honest approach to realistic and achievable exercise goals. title: dad being sent jamaica after
story: NewsDad being deported to Jamaica after  years says hell have to bring kids up over SkypeOwen Haisley, , came to Britain at the age of four and was given the right to remain here - but is now due to be deported this week on a plane dubbed the convict flightShareCommentsByBeth AbbitAbigail OLeary:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsOwen was arrested on January  this year in connection with an incident in "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA dad who has been earmarked for deportation back to Jamaica after moving to the UK aged , says he will now have to bring his kids up via Skype. Owen Haisley, , has been living in Britain for  years and was given the right to remain here. But after serving a short sentence for assault in  - his status to legally remain in the UK has been ripped up. He is one of  people with Jamaican roots who are due to be deported on Wednesday - and flown there on a plane dubbed the convict flight by a Jamaican national newspaper, The Gleaner. Owen says the government have given him the choice of flying his children over, or speaking to the online. The distraught dad said: My children need me. I’ve been told they can either travel over and see me or I have got to keep in touch via Skype. All passengers on the so-called convict flight are alleged to have committed offences in the past. Owen says he has no family in Jamaica and hasnt been on the island since he left as a toddler. Speaking about his ordeal, Owen described how he was arrested on January  before being taken to a holding facility near Heathrow in relation to an incident in .  Speaking to the Manchester Evening News from the detention centre, he said: I hold my hands up, I have made mistakes but I have gone to prison, done my time for it, done rehabilitation and restorative justice, and they say I can’t have a second chance.Why do I have to be sent to another country and bring my children up on Skype  Owen moved to the UK in  with his mum, who was a nurse - and was given permission to remain with no restrictions. He was convicted in  of domestic assault and spent a year at HMP Risley. Owen was then told by immigration he would need to apply for the right to remain a UK resident. After a three year battle with the Home Office, Owen was arrested while signing on at an immigration centre in Salford on January . He has now been told he’s due to board a plane with another  people on Wednesday which will deport them to Jamaica. Owen, whose great aunt was part of the Windrush generation, says he is devastated at the thought of being separated from his young children. He said: Offenders with a British passport can repeatedly offend and be given another chance. I’m not a repeat offender.” Owen worked at Afflecks Palace, an indoor market, and became a well known a drum and bass and jungle DJ and MC - with residences at city centre nightclubs such as Vogue, Dry Bar and Music Box. He spent  years teaching music workshops to young people as part of the organisation Greater Manchester Music Action Zone and most recently worked as a mobile phone executive. He has worked legally with the National Insurance number he was given when he was  and paid taxes.   Owen, who holds a Jamaican passport, first spent time in London after arriving in the UK, before moving to Manchester with his great aunt  years go. He says he was originally told he had overstayed in the UK and a deportation order was issued in August . Following ious appeals to the Home Office over the last three years, he was detained and ordered to be deported on a charter flight to Jamaica last year - days after the Windrush scandal broke. But the flight was cancelled for reasons the Home Office didn’t disclose. Owen ed to Manchester but was detained again last week while signing on at a Home Office centre in Salford. He was taken to Manchester Central police station and held before being taken to Morton Hall Immigration Removal Centre. Owen has been at Harmondsworth immigration centre, in Middlesex, since last Sunday. He said: It’s like a prison. We’re in cells and there’s a regime a bit like a prison regime. It’s cold, the food is not that great and we’re restricted to using things like internet. “They’ve got this flight set up for Wednesday and I think they will give everyone decisions on their status that day and we won’t be able to stop it,” Owen says. “I’ve not been back to Jamaica since I left as a kid. I have been over here for a long time, I don’t know anyone over there. “Everyone got the impression of it’s a nice place as a tourist. For someone being deported you will be right in the middle of things. Where will I live and how will I survive financially    “We have been told  of us will be put on a flight accompanied by  enforcement officers will sit with us and Jamaican police will meet us and put us into a holding place. Anyone of interest to the Jamaican police will be held and everyone  will be let go.” Owen admits that he never thought to apply for a British passport because he had lived and worked in the country for so long without a problem - a decision he now regrets. He says he is worried about ing to a country he hasn’t set foot in since he was a young child with no family or friends to lean on. Owen added: “The Home Office say because of my criminality they want to deport me.” “I just wanna be given a second chance like everyone  that does a crime and serves time. “I came over here legally. I’ve lost it all because of a  month imprisonment.” Owen says he is also worried how the arrival of the flight will be received in Jamaica after hitting the headlines. Its gone out in the Gleaner. We have been set as targets. People have this impression thatyoure from England you have lots of money. But they wont even give you a change of clothing here, he said. The Home Office is issuing booklets on how to be Jamaican. Ive seen the posters in the detention centres. Friends of Owen have started a petition calling on MPs to intervene in his case in the hope they can persuade the Home Office to cancel his deportation. A Home Office spokesperson said: The UK, like many other countries, uses charter flights topeople to their country of origin where they no longer have a right to remain. The majority of those being ed are ed on scheduled, commercial flights but this isn’t always an option, especially where the inidual may be a foreign national offender.

title: meghan markles friend being waterboarded
story: NewsMeghan Markles friend being waterboarded and given electric shocks in jailLoujain-al-Hathloul, , is being held in a Saudi Arabian jail in solitary confinement, beaten and threatened with rapeShareCommentsByAnthony Harwood:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsMegan and Loujain Al Hathloul "Get Royal Family updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA friend of Meghan Markle - who once shared a Vanity Fair photo shoot with the royal - is being beaten, waterboarded and given electric shocks in a Saudi Arabian jail, according to a cross party  of MPs. A parliamentary report said Loujain-al-Hathloul, , is being held in solitary confinement, beaten and threatened with rape and murder for calling for an end to the country’s restrictive male ship system. Three years ago Loujain appeared with the then-Meghan Markle in a Vanity Fair photo shoot in Canada for One Young World. At the time of the summit, Meghan wrote: One Young World invites young adults from all over the road who are actively working to transform the socio-political landscape.   They are delegates who are speaking out against human rights violations, environmental crises, gender equality issues, discrimination and injustice. They are the change. The report said that one of Loujain’s torturers is the same man named as the leader of the hit squad which murdered Jamal Khashoggi. Saud al-Qahtani is reported to have told one of the eight women detainees: I’ll do whatever I like to you, and then dissolve you and flush you down the toilet. The Detention Review Panelreport says al-Qahtani was frequently present during Loujain’s torture, at times laughing at her or threatening to rape and kill her.   During the murder of Khashoggi he was said to have ordered the journalist’s killing on Skype with the words: Bring me the head of the dog. Khashoggi’s body has never been found and it’s believed his dismembered parts were dissolved in acid and either flushed away or buried in woods. The DRP report said one detainee was photographed naked and the picture then put on a table in front of her during questioning. It went on: At least one of the detainees was stripped naked in front of several of the interrogators, touched in intimate places while handcuffed and repeatedly taunted with phrases such as: ‘Where are the human rights defenders to help you  The three MPs, Crispin Blunt, Layla Moran and Paul Williams, said ‘Saudi authorities at the highest levels could, in principle, be responsible for the crime of torture’.  The detainees have been vocal supporters of women’s right to drive, announced by the authorities last year, and have also pushed for an end to the male ship system. In Saudi Arabia, women need permission of a man – either a father, husband or even a son – to do things like getting a job, travelling or getting married. The report was released after repeated requests from the three politicians for permission to visit the women in jail were ignored. DRP chairman, Crispin Blunt, said: Our conclusions are stark. The Saudi women activist detainees have been treated so badly as to sustain an international investigation for torture.  Denied proper access to medical care, legal advice or visits from their families, their solitary confinement and mistreatment are severe enough to meet the international definitions of torture. The supervisory chain of command up to the highest levels of Saudi authority would be responsible for this. Loujain’s brother talked about the horric ordeal his sister is being subjected to. Walid-al-Hathloul said: Whenever Loujain spoke about the torture sessions with my parents, her hands shook uncontrollably. I fear the pain will stay with her forever. My own baby sister said she is being whipped, beaten, electrocuted and harassed on a frequent basis. She said that sometimes there are masked men who wake her up in the middle of the night to shout unimaginable threats.

story: NewsProfessional bridesmaid reveals weirdest and most shocking things shes been asked to doTfany Wright decided to set up a business as a professional bridesmaid in  after she attended  weddings in just two years and saw a lot of stressed bridesShareCommentsByZoe ForseyActing Audience Editor:,  FEB NewsTfany Wright has worked with lots of self-confessed bridezillas "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email Tfany Wright is the proud owner of LOTS of bridesmaid dresses .As well as standing next to some of her closest pals on their special days, shes also had the honour for complete strangers after setting up her own professional bridesmaid business. Shes helped more than  brides over the past two years offering her expertise and guidance to try and make the planning, hen weekend and wedding day itself run smoothly.Shes worked with lots of lovely brides, but also some self-confessed bridezillas who have made some very odd requests.Tfany has been asked to dye her hair to match the other bridesmaids and to make the rest of the wedding party lose weight. Shes also been sent to Ibiza to spy on the grooms stag do.   Tfany said: All these women are self proclaimed bridezillas - they seem to wear the title like a badge of honour. Ive had someone ask for my advice onto have a friend of hers as a bridesmaid because she was trying to get pregnant, and the bride didnt want a pregnant bridesmaid. Its crazy what people can be concerned about.   At one of the weddings, Tfany was asked to keep the photographer away from two attractive guests so they didnt outshine the bride. Referring to another wedding, Tfany said: One bride had her mind set on which bridesmaids dresses she wanted and was concerned some of her curvier friends wouldnt fit or suit them so as a discreet way of helping them lose weight, I organised a wellness weekend for them all which was basically a weightloss bootcamp. We spent the weekend doing yoga, eating salads and working out so it definitely wasnt your typical pre-wedding party. We were all in bed by pm most nights - its safe to say there werent any penis straws or Jagerbomb during our trip. Tfany also had to deal with a bride who had a hen-do gt list whereby the cheapest gt was pound.   Tfany, who lives in Oxfordshire, has earned a small fortune by charging up to pound, per wedding. She is now sharing her experiences of bridezillas for the first time after claiming its not the easy job that most assume. She came up with the idea of becoming a professional bridesmaid after she attending  weddings in two years and noticed a common theme at them all - an extremely stressed bride. She added: Whilst sometimes I am undercover, by the end of the wedding, and after the bride has had a few drinks, they often end up telling people who I am and that they actually only met me a couple of weeks ago.   Tfany has helped over  brides now, and been an actual bridesmaid at peoples weddings seven times - on other occasions, shes acted more as a bridal personal assistant. She said: Sometimes not having a personal or family connection to someone can be a bonus with some tasks. For example, one brides parents had orced and her dad wanted to bring his new girlfriend - who was a similar age to her - with him to the wedding and it was my job to break the news to her mum. It can be a dficult job at times but its unique and I couldnt wish for a better career despite the bridezillas.

story: NewsSix-stone man who can barely walk gets benefits back after being told to find workStephen Smith, from Kensington, Liverpool, was forced to get a pass out from hospital to fight the Department of Work and PensionsShareCommentsByLiam ThorpBradley JollyJonathan Humphries:,  FEB Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news uk-news video man-who-weighed-barely-six-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news uk-news  , theme : # , title : Mirror UK News ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news uk-news  , theme : # , title : Mirror UK News ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A man who was told to find work despite weighing just six stone and being barely able to walk will finally get paid all the benefits hes entitled to, it emerged today.Stephen Smith, , became so weak and unwell he was admitted to hospital over Christmas.But, despite struggling walk, he was deemed fit to work by the Department of Work and Pensions. Mr Smith got a pass out from hospital to fight the cruel decision, which had repeatedly denied him Employment Support Allowance , and has finally won his appeal, the Liverpool Echo reports.Now, Stephen will receive back-payments for the money he has wrongly been denied, including all ESA sums. A spokesman for the DWP said: We are sorry for the experience Mr Smith has had and we are committed to ensuring that people with health conditions get the support theyre entitled to.   Following the independent tribunal’s ruling, he is now receiving full ESA support. While Mr Smith continued to receive benefits and support during his appeal, we can confirm he will shortly receive all back-payments for ESA due.”Repeated calls to grant Stephen ESA were denied - despite written evidence from doctors stating that he couldnt walk for  metres without collapsing with pain and exhaustion.Stephen, of Kensington, Liverpool, has suffered with a number of serious conditions for several years. His most debilitating illness is Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease, an incurable respiratory problem that causes severe breathing issues and gets worse over time. But he also suffers with excruciating Osteoarthritis, has an enlarged prostate and uses a colostomy bag to go to the toilet.   Despite all of this, he failed a DWP work capability assesment in  - which meant his ESA payments were stopped and he was told to sign on for a pound a week Jobseekers Allowance, visit the job centre once a week and prove he was looking for work. Throughout this period, Stephen was living alone and didnt know where to turn as his health deteriorated. He said: I could only make it to the kitchen to make food once a day. I had no muscles in the back of my leg which meant I couldnt stand up at all - and had to lean or sit down all the time - but they were telling me I was fit for work. He believes he could have diedit wasnt for two men, Tony Nelson and Terry Craven. Tony runs the CASA community centre in Hope Street which offers support to people who dont know where to turn.   Tony introduced Mr Smith to Terry, a former city council welfare officer who works at the CASA advising people on benefit claims. After Stephen was kicked off ESA, Terry took up his case and battled with the DWP to get him the benefits he knew he deserved. In response to the DWPs U-turn, Terry said: It is an outrage for a senior citizen of one of the richest countries in the world to have been treated like this by a Government department. Steve should not have been deprived of his just entitlement for a week let alone two years. He has worked all his le and ran several businesses successfully. This Government’s policies and its denial of poverty are challenged by Steve’s circumstances. No justication could possibly exonerate this Govermment’s responsibility for Steve’s plight. I am just glad this is not a death story. Am I owed back payments  Most of those affected are people who moved from incapacity benefit to the contributory version of ESA. The DWP says it will contact those hit. How much am I owed  The average payment so far has been pound,. Early estimates suggested a small number lost poundk. About , entitled to the severe disability premium were estimated to be owed around pound, each. When will I be paid  poundm arrears will be paid to , people whose cases post-date  through to April . Another poundm will then be paid to an estimated , people whose cases pre-date  in the   financial year. How will I be paid  The same way you normally get benefits, usually your bank account, within  weeks of being contacted by the DWP. What about claimants who have died  If your relative died while waiting for payment, you should be entitled to claim their benefits. The DWP claims it is trying to find their families so they can have that money. Will that money be paid back with interest  Its not clear. Ms Newton dodged this question when asked directly in the House of Commons. For more information click here.  This included sending the opinions of two separate doctors who both confirmed the signicant dficulty and pain experienced by Mr Smith when completing simple movements and daily activities. One doctors note stated: It is my opinion that Mr Smith could not walk  metres without pain or exhaustion. But despite this, in January last year, his appeal was rejected by the DWP who told him that he hadnt scored the required number of points to deem him as having limited capability for work. But Stephen and Terry continued to battle over the next year and eventually were granted the chance to fight the decision in a tribunal earlier this month -  months on from that DWP rejection. Speaking today, Terry said: I have got lots of cases like Steves - I have a client at the moment who is actually on dialysis and has been thrown off benefits.

story: NewsSize XXXXL woman who nearly drowned because she was so big loses st to become catwalk modelDominique Montgomery, , survived for years on nothing by greasy fast food - eventually reaching stlb - before a fateful day at the beach changed her le foreverShareCommentsByErin Cardf:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsDominique before she lost weight "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA size XXXXL woman who nearly drowned when she was too heavy to lted from the water has transformed her le to become a catwalk model. Dominique Montgomery, , survived for years on nothing by greasy fast food - eventually reaching stlb. Despite suffering cruel taunts and bullying - even once having a burrito thrown at her by a total stranger at a football game - Dominique never lost sight of her dream to become a model. Now, following a remarkable transformation whereby she shed  stone, Dominique has strutted her stuff on the runway at the USAs celebrated Los Angeles Fashion Week - and will repeat the experience at the New York shows next month. Reliving the terrying  day which changed her le, after she became trapped by a rapidly rising tide, Dominique, of Los Angeles, Calornia, said: “I always wanted to model, but was so focused on being overweight that I had no idea how it would happen. “But now, my confidence has improved so much and I have learned not to be so hard on myself.   “I can’t explain how exciting it feels to be up on that runway. You can’t even see anything as the lights are so bright – all you can hear are cheers.” Embarking on her first diet aged just five, so big her school unorms had to be specially made, Dominique, who has also started her own personal training business, combining mindfulness with fitness and nutrition, has fought a lelong battle with her weight. After trying and failing on a multitude of diets, eventually resigning herself to a letime of obesity, she admitted: “I struggled with an eating disorder that most people don’t talk about – binge eating. “I couldn’t control how much I ate and, eventually, I stopped caring. As I was already so big, I thought nobody would noticeI ate more.”  Enjoying a staple diet of fast food and takeaways, washed down with fizzy pop, Dominique struggled with portion control and regularly ordered meals like fried chicken with double chips and two biscuits – a scone-like buttermilk bake – or a burrito “as big as her head,” with two large tacos on the side. “I would eat at least , calories a day. Sometimes, I would have large shakes for dessert that were about , calories by themselves,” she said. Her self-esteem shrinking with every pound she gained, Dominique eventually took to eating in her car, away from the prying eyes of judgemental strangers.   She added: “My confidence was low. I felt very hopeless and began to irrationally blame every problem in my le on being big.” But everything changed in July , during a day at the beach with friends. She recalled: “I was swimming around, feeling great, when all of a sudden, the tide got high. “Everyone managed to push themselves out of the water onto some rocks, but I was stuck, because I wasn’t physically able to lt myself out. Everyone tried to help, but I was too heavy. “I thought I was going to die and had no idea what to do. I was terried.” Thankfully, she managed to hold on until the water calmed, but she was left severely shaken. She added: “If I couldn’t even help myself out of the water, then what was I doing with my le ” Since then, Dominique, who now weighs just over st and is a UK size eight, has embarked on a healthy regime, ditching the fast food and heading to the gym. But, having been left with folds of excess skin - particularly around her stomach - by her rapid weight loss, while she has toned up slightly by working out, she is also saving for ,surgery to remove it.   Around four months ago, keen to help to others beginning their own weight loss journeys, she even launched her own personal training company. “Lots of people were asking me how to lose weight, so I wanted to devise something that tackles fitness and nutrition as well as mindset. It’s important to look at why people have gotten to that point, and what is stunting their progress,” she said. “I am hoping to eventually make it an online business, so anyone from anywhere in the world can get involved.” Then, in October , after finding herself an agent and trainer, Dominique fulfilled her lelong ambition - becoming a runway star at Los Angeles Fashion Week, modelling for brands Lorenz Couture and Esti Nay, as well as in showcases for The Model Experience and Model Mafia LA. And, shining in the spotlight, all her insecurities about her remaining apron of skin melted away. She added: “With my first show, it did cause a little problem as I’d applied some  tan, which ended up uneven where my skin folded over – but I changed outfit last minute so you couldn’t see it.   “I prefer walking in couture shows, as you can wear lovely long, flowing gowns but either way, when you’re up there, it’s so exciting that you don’t think about much .” In February, Dominique will also be giving a repeat performance at New York Fashion Week, and hopes it will pave the way to one day realising her ultimate dream of starring in the iconic Victoria’s Secret fashion show. “The designs are impeccable, and it is just such a renowned show,” she sighed. Her le – and body – now unrecognisable, Dominique has even written a book called The Gt, in which she shares everything she has learnt about confidence, self-belief and achieving your goals. “All I want to do now is help and motivate people in any way I can,” she said. “I also want to reassure people that it’s okay to go at their own pace and that every dream, everything that starts with a thought, is absolutely possible.”

title: spent week living universal credit
story: NewsI spent a week living on Universal Credit - this is what its likeReceiving weekly allowance for a -year-old, one young reporter ended up with just £ a day to spend on food, heating and travelShareCommentsByAlex GroveBen Weich:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror incoming video what-is-universal-credit-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news uk-news  , theme : # , title : Mirror UK News ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news uk-news  , theme : # , title : Mirror UK News ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true""Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe Governments controversial Universal Credit scheme has rarely been out of the headlines during its troubled roll-out across the country.Stories abound of claimants having to turn to food banks, and the programme was recently revealed to have the lowest satisfaction score of any welfare benefit.But what is it actually like to live on Universal Credit  Keen to demonstrate the adversities faced by those on the scheme, Hull Live reporter Alex Grove volunteered to live solely on a weekly benefits allowance, based on calculations made by the Citizens Advice Bureau. As a -year-old man living in private rented shared accommodation, with no disabilities or children, he received pound. for the month – or roughly pound. per week. But even that was quickly chipped away at by deductions, with Hull City Council tax taking pound. a week, and a further pound was set aside for gas and electric.   Alex was left with scarcely more than pound per week – not taking into account water rates, his mobile phone contract, car insurance or road tax. The most he was offered to go towards his rent was pound. a week, with any shortfall coming out of his own pocket. He said: That left me with pound a day, and I quickly realised some of my typical outgoings during the week would have to be signicantly reduced. With a limited amount of money to spend, I soon realised just how much money I waste during the week, particularly during my days at work. Takeaways were also a no-go. Lazily, I do sometimes find myself having a scroll through Deliveroo and picking out a meal or heading over to McDonalds – particularly when I’m hungover. But having a takeaway even just once a week would completely wipe out my budget, so I had no choice but to make the most of my weekly food shops and resist indulging on junk food.   It soon dawned on Alex that even Tesco meal deals – priced at pound, or half his daily allowance – would have to fall by the wayside, too. Alex added: I am a sucker for a Tesco meal deal which sets me back pound a day and although it’s a great offer, it costs me almost half of my daily budget. I knew I had to change my ways so every night I made sandwiches to take into work and bought multipacks of crisps instead of wasting money buying inidual packs as part of a meal deal. Universal Credit, dubbed a “six-in-one” payment, has been labelled a “shambles” by critical MPs. Earlier this month, the Works and Pensions Secretary Amber Rudd announced a string of changes to save Universal Credit from further disaster, but maintains it will be fully implemented by . Margaret Greenwood, Labours shadow Work and Pensions Secretary, has called for it to be halted entirely, claiming that it has been used as a vehicle for cuts to social security.   Reporting in Hull Live, Alex said he found that there was no room for me to be able to afford what most would constitute as a respectable social le. He wrote: Couple of pints down the pub with your mates  No chance. A meal out at a restaurant  In your dreams. On the budget I had, there just wasn’t enough money to go towards typical social activities for a man of my age. I like a tipple sometimes after a day at work, but this was something I just could not financially manage given the limited budget I had at my disposal.   Yes, you can buy packs of lager and cider in supermarkets and minimarts but these will still set you back and realistically, alcohol is something you just have to do without. He also described paying for his car to be unrealistic, as fuel prices, road tax and breakdown cover piled up. He was left to fork out for public transport fares to get to his local Jobcentre to sign on. The young reporter concluded that his weekly allowance on Universal Credit was adequate, as long as he managed to resist indulging in alcohol or recreational activities.   He said: I would have been living on the breadline and, although you receive more moneyyou have children and other relatives to look after, ultimately, you have more mouths to feed and that presents dficulties. There is a high possibility, particularly at a time when we are experiencing sub-zero temperatures, that I would have had to endure freezing cold nights and sacriced my warmth in order to get by.

story: NewsStunned walker spots PUMA lurking near Derbyshire football pitchIan Harvey, , from Swadlincote, Derbyshire, claims he encountered the giant feline while out for a morning strollShareCommentsByHayley Coyle:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsIan Harvey said the cat seemed completely unafraid of him"Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA stunned walker claims he spotted a PUMA basking in the sunshine near a Derbyshire football pitch. Wildle fan Ian Harvey says he came face to face with the “frightening big cat” during a morning stroll. He claims the creature was “basking in the sunshine” and lying down against the hedgerows close to the pitch.Mr Harvey, , was left “in shock” as the cat apparently started skulking towards him, Derbyshire Live reports.And he’s not the only walker to have reportedly seen the feline beast. The canopy-maker recalled: “I walked on towards the football pitch and saw something lying down against the hedgerows on the opposite side of the pitch that I thought was a deer.  It was facing the road. I took another five or six steps and and it turned its head towards me and looked right at me. At that point, I though thats a cat - its got a cats face. “It carried on staring at me and I was staring back. I dared not go any closer. Im probably about  yards away by now.” Mr Harvey also said that he was convinced the animal was a puma because of its “unmistakable big cat curved tail”. He went on: It was a bit frightening when I realised what I was seeing - I know all about big cats and pumas have been known to attack people in America. It didnt seem the slightest bit scared to see me.  I can only presume its roaming around the Swadlincote area and the reason it was in the park was because it had been a very cold night and it was in direct sunlight, lying there to get warm. Mr Harveys reported sighting happened at around am on January  at a park on Occupation Road, Albert Village. The wildle enthusiast, from Swadlincote, had gone for a walk on his morning break in pursuit of a kestrel he was watching. His sighting of a puma - which is typically found in the mountains of North and South America - is one of many reported instances of big cats roaming around the area.
